topics.title: Derivative Control
topics.description: Exploring the derivative control component of a PID controller.

topics.title: Derivative Control Cannot Operate Alone
topics.description: The derivative control relies on other components to drive the error signal.
evidence_quotes: Let's assume everything is hunky-dory until this time when we introduce some step in R, which generates a step in the error signal.
And now what we can start asking is I can start looking at the slope here.

topics.title: Mathematically Rigorous PID Controller Synthesis
topics.description: Future discussions on mathematically rigorous ways to synthesize a PID controller using techniques like root locus or other methods.
evidence_quotes: Well, what we instead want to do in some of our future discussions is look at mathematically rigorous ways to synthesize a PID controller, a.k.a. pick those gains, using things like root locus or other techniques.

topics.title: PID Controller
topics.description: Discussion about using a PID controller to correct non-zero error.
evidence_quotes: So we need the PID controller to try to fix this error and make this error go to zero.
Now, you might ask, is there something better I can do?

topics.title: PID Controller Basics
topics.description: Introduction to PID controllers, their simplicity, and how they work.

topics.title: PID Controller Demonstration
topics.description: Demonstrates how the PID controller works with different fluids (water, air, honey) and its components (proportional, derivative, integrator)
evidence_quotes: When we increase the damping ratio or excuse me, increase the D component of the PID controller, you see there's a lot less oscillations, right?
The D component is way too high. So you can see the thing does not want to move, but it is moving, right?
All the control authority is coming from the pink string.

topics.title: PID Controller Tuning
topics.description: Rules of thumb for tuning PID controller gains, including the importance of moderation and avoiding instability.
evidence_quotes: It's again one of these things, everything in moderation.
You don't want to go overboard because you definitely can drive things unstable with the large KD.

topics.title: Proportional Component
topics.description: Explanation of the proportional component of a PID controller and its relationship to the error.
evidence_quotes: The proportional component of the controller, it's going to be a control signal which is directly proportional to this error.
So I've got a stiffer rubber band here.

topics.title: Proportional Control
topics.description: Exploring the proportional control component of a PID controller.

topics.title: Steady State Error
topics.description: Discussion about the existence of steady state error with a proportional controller.
evidence_quotes: So we see there is steady state error in this case.
But again, the problem with the proportional controller is again, no matter how stiff you make it.

topics.title: The Integrator
topics.description: How the integrator works and its limitations
evidence_quotes: So it's probably something like this, right?
You multiply it by some Ki, you probably get some small numbers.
And et cetera, et cetera. You can see what this is going to be doing is it's going to keep going.
